slides.title: User Story: Invoicing Method
slides.originalNotes:
User Story: Invoicing Method
Shown here is an example user story requirement requested by a fictional business analyst.
slides.notes:
User Story: Invoicing Method
Shown here is an example user story requirement requested by a fictional business analyst.
slides.ocrText:
User Story: Invoicing Method Gi

“After further analysis, we decided that the invoicing method of each policy also has
to be stored in TrainingApp. The invoicing method specifies how the premium will be
collected for the policy. An insurance company allows only the following 3 invoicing
methods:

« 10% down payment and 11 installments
« 30% down payment and 4 installments
« 50% down payment and 2 installments

We are still working on the UI requirements, so please configure the Data Model
only for now.”

- Insurance Company Business Analysts
Gi

slides.title: i Typelist
slides.originalNotes:
Typelist

Whenever there is a drop-down list in an InsuranceSuite application interface, it is usually a Typelist. If Guidewire defines a typelist as final, it is not possible to add or delete typecodes from the typelist.
slides.notes:
Typelist

Whenever there is a drop-down list in an InsuranceSuite application interface, it is usually a Typelist. If Guidewire defines a typelist as final, it is not possible to add or delete typecodes from the typelist.

slides.title: i Typelists and Typekey fields
slides.originalNotes:
Typelists and Typekey fields

The specified typelist limits the available field values to those defined in the typelist- If you filter the typelist, the field displays a subset of the typelist values.
slides.notes:
Typelists and Typekey fields

The specified typelist limits the available field values to those defined in the typelist- If you filter the typelist, the field displays a subset of the typelist values.
slides.ocrText:
i Typelists and Typekey fields

• ATypekey field is an entity field associated with a specific Typelist
• Referenced Typelist contains the list of possible values for the Typekey field

* The Typekey field can point to one of these Typecodes

BankAccount

BankName
RoutingNumber

AccountNumber

Typekey field

Typelist

BankAccountType

Checking
Savings
Other

Typecodes

slides.title: i Kinds of Typelists
slides.originalNotes:
Kinds of Typelists
In some cases, an internal typelist does not have a physical file that is exposed in Guidewire Studio. One type of virtual typelist is a typelist of subtypes for a given supertype. You will not find the virtual typelists in Studio, but you can see the Java classes that get generated from them. For example, you can use the CTRL + SHIFT + N to search for ABContact.java and you will see that one of the search results is in the configuration\generated\typekey folder but there is not matching physical typelist

Typelists with the final="true“ attribute defined in the <typelist element cannot be extended. An internal typelist extension (TIX) file can only be found in the folder.

You can always determine to base configuration for a Guidewire application by looking at the zip file.
slides.notes:
Kinds of Typelists
In some cases, an internal typelist does not have a physical file that is exposed in Guidewire Studio. One type of virtual typelist is a typelist of subtypes for a given supertype. You will not find the virtual typelists in Studio, but you can see the Java classes that get generated from them. For example, you can use the CTRL + SHIFT + N to search for ABContact.java and you will see that one of the search results is in the configuration\generated\typekey folder but there is not matching physical typelist

Typelists with the final="true“ attribute defined in the <typelist element cannot be extended. An internal typelist extension (TIX) file can only be found in the folder.

You can always determine to base configuration for a Guidewire application by looking at the zip file.

slides.title: i Typelists in the data model
slides.originalNotes:
Typelists in the data model
For an entity to be able to access and use a typelist, you need to define a <typekey> element on that entity. Use the <typekey> element to specify the typelist in the entity metadata.
slides.notes:
Typelists in the data model
For an entity to be able to access and use a typelist, you need to define a <typekey> element on that entity. Use the <typekey> element to specify the typelist in the entity metadata.
slides.ocrText:
i Typelists in the data model G

• Follow similar
principles as entities

* Defined as XML files
* TTI, TIX and TTX files

« ...\Metadata\Typelist
folder read-only and
contains platform and
base application
Typelists

« ...\Extensions\Typelist
folder contains
everything customer
specific

slides.title: i Typelists and Typekey fields in the database
slides.originalNotes:
Typelists and Typekey fields in the database

Making changes to Typelists, Typecodes, and Typekeys generate changes to the Data Model. Guidewire recommends that you regenerate the InsuranceSuite application's Data Dictionary if you make any updates to the Data Model. If you have made any mistakes in the previous steps, regenerating the data dictionary helps to identify those mistakes.
slides.notes:
Typelists and Typekey fields in the database

Making changes to Typelists, Typecodes, and Typekeys generate changes to the Data Model. Guidewire recommends that you regenerate the InsuranceSuite application's Data Dictionary if you make any updates to the Data Model. If you have made any mistakes in the previous steps, regenerating the data dictionary helps to identify those mistakes.
slides.ocrText:
i Typelists and Typekey fields in the database

Typelists are stored as database tables

Typecodes are stored as rows in the table

Typekeys are stored as foreign key

columns in the entity table

slides.title: i Typelists and Typekeys in the object model
slides.originalNotes:
Typelists and Typekeys in the object model
Ensure that you fully understand the dependencies between typelists and other application files before you modify a typelist. In general, Guidewire does not recommend that you make changes to existing typelists other than the following:

Extending a non-final typelist to add additional typekeys.
Retiring a typekey, which makes it invisible in the ClaimCenter interface, but leaves the typekey in the application database.
slides.notes:
Typelists and Typekeys in the object model
Ensure that you fully understand the dependencies between typelists and other application files before you modify a typelist. In general, Guidewire does not recommend that you make changes to existing typelists other than the following:

Extending a non-final typelist to add additional typekeys.
Retiring a typekey, which makes it invisible in the ClaimCenter interface, but leaves the typekey in the application database.

slides.title: i Typefilters
slides.originalNotes:
Typefilters
A Typefilter defines a named subset of the Typecodes that could be used as value for the associated Typekey field that references this Typelist.
slides.notes:
Typefilters
A Typefilter defines a named subset of the Typecodes that could be used as value for the associated Typekey field that references this Typelist.
slides.ocrText:
i Typefilters G
• ATypelist filter causes the Typelist to display only a subset of the Typecodes for
that Typelist
• Multiple Typefilters can be defined in a Typelist

• ATypekey field can reference at most one Typefilter from the associated Typelist

slides.title: Knowledge Check
slides.ocrText:
Question
_- — What are some of the differences between the files in the
..\Metadata\Typelist\ and...\Extensions\Typelist\ folders?

questionData.question: What are some of the differences between the files in the
questionData.answer: SS Se SSeS sess e eases : ..\Metadata\Typelist\ and...\Extensions\Typelist\ folders? Files under Metadata are read-only and are specific to the base configuration. You cannot create Typelist files in the Metadata directory but can create Typelist files in the Extensions directory. Only internal Typelist extension files (TIX) are in the Metadata directory. Only external Typelist files (TTX) are in the Extensions directory. Both directories contain Typelist (TT1) files.

slides.title: Answer
slides.ocrText:
Answer
_- — What are some of the differences between the files in the
•
•
SS Se SSeS sess e eases
: ..\Metadata\Typelist\ and...\Extensions\Typelist\ folders?
Files under Metadata are read-only and are specific to the base configuration.
You cannot create Typelist files in the Metadata directory but can create Typelist
files in the Extensions directory.
Only internal Typelist extension files (TIX) are in the Metadata directory.
Only external Typelist files (TTX) are in the Extensions directory.
Both directories contain Typelist (TT1) files.

slides.title: Knowledge Check
slides.ocrText:
Question
Which Typecode attribute determines the order in which Typecodes are
listed in the user interface?
Gi

questionData.question: Which Typecode attribute determines the order in which Typecodes are
questionData.answer: Listed in the user interface? “ The priority attribute determines the sort order in the User Interface for a Typelist. After priority, the name (not code) determines the sort order. Entries with priority -1 appear at the end of the list. SS Se SSeS sess e eases

slides.title: Answer
slides.ocrText:
Answer
Which Typecode attribute determines the order in which Typecodes are
listed in the user interface?
“ The priority attribute determines the sort order in the User Interface for a Typelist. After
priority, the name (not code) determines the sort order. Entries with priority -1 appear
at the end of the list.
SS Se SSeS sess e eases
Gi
